segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ānando kosalesu viharati aññatarasmiṃ vanasaṇḍe.
segments.en: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ānando ativelaṃ gihisaññattibahulo viharati.
segments.en: Now at that time Ānanda was spending too much time informing the lay people.

segments.pli: Atha kho yā tasmiṃ vanasaṇḍe adhivatthā devatā āyasmato ānandassa anukampikā atthakāmā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ saṃvejetukāmā yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
segments.en: Then the deity haunting that forest had compassion for Ānanda, wanting what’s best for him. So they approached him wanting to stir him up, and recited these verses:
“You’ve left for the jungle, the root of a tree,
Practice absorption, Gotama, don’t be negligent!
What is this hullabaloo to you?”

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando tāya devatāya saṃvejito saṃvegamāpādīti.
segments.en: Impelled by that deity, Venerable Ānanda was struck with a sense of urgency.
